column4: The words of Nechemyah [God comforts] the son of Hakhalyah [whom Yehovah enlightens] . And it came to pass in the month Kislev [his confidence] , in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan [lily] the palace,

That Hanani [gracious] , one of my brethren, came, he and [certain] men of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] ; and I asked them concerning the Y’hudim (Judeans) that had escaped, which were left of the captivity, and concerning Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace].

And they said unto me, The remnant that are left of the captivity there in the province [are] in great affliction and reproach (disgrace; shame) : the wall of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] also [is] broken down, and the gates thereof are burned with fire.
And it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned [certain] days, and fasted, and prayed before the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of heaven,

And said, I beseech (to call upon; appeal; beg) you i , O Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of heaven, the great and terrible God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , that keeps covenant and mercy for them that love him and observe his commandments:

Let you i ear now be attentive, and you i eyes open, that you i may hear the prayer of you i servant, which I pray before you i now, day and night, for the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] you i servants, and confess the sins of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , which we have sinned against you i : both I and my father’s house have sinned.
We have dealt very corruptly against you i , and have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the judgments, which you i commanded you i servant Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters].

Remember, I beseech (to call upon; appeal; beg) you i , the word that you i commanded you i servant Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , saying, [If] you 2f transgress, I will scatter you abroad among the nations:

But [if] you 2f turn unto me, and keep my commandments, and do them; though there were of you cast out unto the uttermost part of the heaven, [yet] will I gather them from there, and will bring them unto the place that I have chosen to set my name there.
Now these [are] you i servants and you i people, whom you i have redeemed by you i great power, and by you i strong hand.

O Lord-Adonai (The Father) [Greatest Above All Things] , I beseech (to call upon; appeal; beg) you i , let now you i ear be attentive to the prayer of you i servant, and to the prayer of you i servants, who desire to fear you i name: and prosper, I pray you i , you i servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man. For I was the king’s cupbearer.

And it came to pass in the month Nisan [their flight] , in the twentieth year of Artach’shashta [I will make the spoiled to boil: I will stir myself (in) winter] the king, [that] wine [was] before him: and I took up the wine, and gave [it] unto the king. Now I had not been [formerly] sad in his presence.

For what reason the king said unto me, Why [is] you i Countenance (Face, appearance; show favor) sad, seeing you i [are] not sick? this [is] nothing [else] but sorrow of heart. Then I was very sore afraid,

And said unto the king, Let the king live forever: why should not my Countenance (Face, appearance; show favor) be sad, when the city, the place of my fathers’ sepulchres, [lies] waste, and the gates thereof are consumed with fire?
Then the king said unto me, For what do you i make request? So I prayed to the God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of heaven.

And I said unto the king, If it please the king, and if you i servant have found favour in you i sight, that you i would send me unto Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , unto the city of my fathers’ sepulchres, that I may build it.
And the king said unto me, (the queen also sitting by him,) For how long shall you i journey be? and when will you i return? So it pleased the king to send me; and I set him a time.
Moreover I said unto the king, If it please the king, let letters be given me to the governors beyond the river, that they may convey me over till I come into Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised];

And a letter unto Asaf [gatherer] the keeper of the king’s forest, that he may give me timber to make beams for the gates of the palace which [appertained] to the house, and for the wall of the city, and for the house that I shall enter into. And the king granted me, according to the good hand of my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] upon me.
Then I came to the governors beyond the river, and gave them the king’s letters. Now the king had sent captains of the army and horsemen with me.

When Sanvalat [strength] the Horoni [native of twin caves] , and Toviyah [Yehovah is good] the servant, the ‘Amoni [tribal] , heard [of it] , it grieved them exceedingly that there was come a man to seek the welfare of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
So I came to Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and was there three days.

And I arose in the night, I and some few men with me; neither told I [any] man what my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] had put in my heart to do at Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] : neither [was there any] beast with me, save the beast that I rode upon.

And I went out by night by the gate of the valley, even before the dragon well, and to the dung port, and viewed the walls of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , which were broken down, and the gates thereof were consumed with fire.
Then I went on to the gate of the fountain, and to the king’s pool: but [there was] no place for the beast [that was] under me to pass.
Then went I up in the night by the brook, and viewed the wall, and turned back, and entered by the gate of the valley, and [so] returned.

And the rulers knew not to which I went, or what I did; neither had I as yet told [it] to the Y’hudim (Judeans) , nor to the priests, nor to the nobles, nor to the rulers, nor to the rest that did the work.

Then said I unto them, You 2f see the distress that we [are] in, how Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] [lies] waste, and the gates thereof are burned with fire: come, and let us build up the wall of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , that we be no more a reproach (disgrace; shame).

Then I told them of the hand of my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] which was good upon me; as also the king’s words that he had spoken unto me. And they said, Let us rise up and build. So they strengthened their hands for [this] good [work].

But when Sanvalat [strength] the Horoni [native of twin caves] , and Toviyah [Yehovah is good] the servant, the ‘Amoni [tribal] , and Geshem [rain] the Aravi [Arabian] , heard [it] , they laughed us to scorn, and despised us, and said, What [is] this thing that you 2f do? will you 2f rebel against the king?

Then answered I them, and said unto them, The God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of heaven, he will prosper us; therefore we his servants will arise and build: but you 2f have no portion, nor right, nor memorial, in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace].

Then Elyashiv [God restores] the High Priest rose up with his brethren the priests, and they built the Sheep Gate; they sanctified it, and set up the doors of it; even unto the tower of Me’ah [hundred] they sanctified it, unto the tower of Hanan’el [God has favoured].
And next unto him built the men of Yericho [Its Moon] . And next to them built Zakur [Mindful] the son of Imri [eloquent].
But the fish gate did the sons of Hasna’ah [thorny] build, who [also] laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof, the locks thereof, and the bars thereof.

And next unto them repaired M’remot [elevations] the son of Uriyah [Yehovah is my flame] , the son of Hakotz [thorn] . And next unto them repaired Meshulam [friend] the son of Berekhyah [Yehovah blesses] , the son of Mesheizav’el [God delivers] . And next unto them repaired Tzadok [righteous] the son of Ba’ana [in the affliction].
And next unto them the T’koi [trumpet blast] repaired; but their nobles put not their necks to the work of their Lord-Adon [Lord of the Earth].

Moreover the old gate repaired Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the son of Paseach [limper] , and Meshulam [friend] the son of B’sodyah [with the counsel of Yehovah] ; they laid the beams thereof, and set up the doors thereof, and the locks thereof, and the bars thereof.

And next unto them repaired M’latyah [Yehovah delivered] the Giv’oni [little hill: hilly] , and Yadon [thankful] the Meronoti [joyful shouter] , the men of Giv’on [Hill City] , and of Mitzpah [watchtower] , unto the throne of the governor on this side the river.

Next unto him repaired Uzziel [My Strength is God] the son of Harhayah [fear of Yehovah] , of the goldsmiths. Next unto him also repaired Hananyah [God has favoured] the son of [one of] the apothecaries, and they fortified Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] unto the broad wall.
And next unto them repaired Refayah [healed of Yehovah] the son of Hur [Liberty] , the ruler of the half part of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace].

And next unto them repaired Y’da’yah [Yehovah has known] the son of Harumaf [split nose] , even over against his house. And next unto him repaired Hatush [assembled] the son of Hashavn’yah [whom Yehovah regards].
Malkiyah [my king is Yehovah] the son of Harim [dedicated] , and Hashuv [considerate] the son of Pachat-Mo’av [pit of Mo’av] , repaired the other piece, and the tower of the furnaces.
And next unto him repaired Shalum [retribution] the son of HaLochesh [whisperer] , the ruler of the half part of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , he and his daughters.

The valley gate repaired Hanun [gracious] , and the inhabitants of Zanoach [Cast Off] ; they built it, and set up the doors thereof, the locks thereof, and the bars thereof, and a thousand cubits on the wall unto the dung gate.

But the dung gate repaired Malkiyah [my king is Yehovah] the son of Rekhav [rider] , the ruler of part of Beit-Hakerem [house of the vineyard] ; he built it, and set up the doors thereof, the locks thereof, and the bars thereof.

But the gate of the fountain repaired Shalun [retribution] the son of Kol-Hozah [all-seeing] , the ruler of part of Mitzpah [watchtower] ; he built it, and covered it, and set up the doors thereof, the locks thereof, and the bars thereof, and the wall of the Pool of Shelach [sent] by the king’s garden, and unto the stairs that go down from the city of David [beloved].

After him repaired Nechemyah [God comforts] the son of Azbuk [strong devistation] , the ruler of the half part of Beit’Tzur [House of the Rock] , unto [the place] over against the sepulchres of David [beloved] , and to the pool that was made, and unto the house of the mighty.

After him repaired the Levi’im (Levites) [Joined to] , Rechum [compassion] the son of Bani [built] . Next unto him repaired Hashavyah [Yehovah has considered] , the ruler of the half part of Ke’ilah [Fortress] , in his part.
After him repaired their brethren, Bavai [my goings] the son of Henadad [favour of Hadad] , the ruler of the half part of Ke’ilah [Fortress].
And next to him repaired ‘Ezer [treasure] the son of Yeshua [he is saved] , the ruler of Mitzpah [watchtower] , another piece over against the going up to the armoury at the turning [of the wall].

After him Barukh [Blessed (Favored by God; happy; prosperous)] the son of Zabai [pure] earnestly repaired the other piece, from the turning [of the wall] unto the door of the house of Elyashiv [God restores] the High Priest.

After him repaired M’remot [elevations] the son of Uriyah [Yehovah is my flame] the son of Hakotz [thorn] another piece, from the door of the house of Elyashiv [God restores] even to the end of the house of Elyashiv [God restores].
And after him repaired the priests, the men of the plain.

After him repaired Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] and Hashuv [considerate] over against their house. After him repaired ‘Azaryah [Yehovah has helped] the son of Ma’aseiyah [work of Yehovah] the son of ‘Ananyah [Yehovah clouds] by his house.
After him repaired Binui [built up] the son of Henadad [favour of Hadad] another piece, from the house of ‘Azaryah [Yehovah has helped] unto the turning [of the wall] , even unto the corner.

Palal [judge] the son of Uzai [I shall have my sprinklings] , over against the turning [of the wall] , and the tower which lies out from the king’s high house, that [was] by the court of the prison. After him P’dayah [Yehovah has ransomed] the son of Par’osh [flea].
Moreover the temple servants dwelt in ‘Ofel [hill] , unto [the place] over against the water gate toward the east, and the tower that lies out.
After them the T’koi [trumpet blast] repaired another piece, over against the great tower that lies out, even unto the wall of ‘Ofel [hill].
From above the horse gate repaired the priests, every one over against his house.

After them repaired Tzadok [righteous] the son of Immer [he has said] over against his house. After him repaired also Sh’may’yah [Yehovah hears] the son of Sh’khanyah [dweller with Yehovah] , the keeper of the east gate.

After him repaired Hananyah [God has favoured] the son of Shelemyah [repaid by Yehovah] [repaid by Yehovah] , and Hanun [gracious] the sixth son of Tzalaf [wound] , another piece. After him repaired Meshulam [friend] the son of Berekhyah [Yehovah blesses] over against his chamber.

After him repaired Malkiyah [my king is Yehovah] the goldsmith’s son unto the place of the temple servants, and of the merchants, over against the Gate Mif’kad [command] , and to the going up of the corner.
And between the going up of the corner unto the Sheep Gate repaired the goldsmiths and the merchants.
But it came to pass, that when Sanvalat [strength] heard that we built the wall, he was exceedingly angry, and took great indignation, and mocked the Y’hudim (Judeans).

And he spoke before his brethren and the army of Shomron [watch mountain] , and said, What do these feeble Y’hudim (Judeans) ? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they revive the stones out of the heaps of the rubbish which are burned?
Now Toviyah [Yehovah is good] the ‘Amoni [tribal] [was] by him, and he said, Even that which they build, if a fox go up, he shall even break down their stone wall.
Hear, O our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] ; for we are despised: and turn their reproach (disgrace; shame) upon their own head, and give them for a prey in the land of captivity:
And cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from before you i : for they have provoked [you i ] to anger before the builders.
So built we the wall; and all the wall was joined together unto the half thereof: for the people had a mind to work.

But it came to pass, [that] when Sanvalat [strength] , and Toviyah [Yehovah is good] , and the Arabians, and the ‘Amon [Inbred] , and the Ashdodites, heard that the walls of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] were made up, [and] that the breaches began to be stopped, then they were very exceedingly angry,
And conspired all of them together to come [and] to fight against Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and to hinder it.
Nevertheless we made our prayer unto our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and set a watch against them day and night, because of them.
And Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] said, The strength of the bearers of burdens is decayed, and [there is] much rubbish; so that we are not able to build the wall.
And our adversaries said, They shall not know, neither see, till we come in the midst among them, and slay them, and cause the work to cease.
And it came to pass, that when the Y’hudim (Judeans) which dwelt by them came, they said unto us ten times, From all places from what place you 2f shall return unto us [they will be upon you].
Therefore set I in the lower places behind the wall, [and] on the higher places, I even set the people after their families with their swords, their spears, and their bows.

And I looked, and rose up, and said unto the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, Be not you 2f afraid of them: remember the Lord-Adonai (The Father) [Greatest Above All Things], [which is] great and terrible, and fight for your brethren, your sons, and your daughters, your wives, and your houses.

And it came to pass, when our enemies heard that it was known unto us, and God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] had brought their counsel to nothing, that we returned all of us to the wall, every one unto his work.

And it came to pass from that time forth, [that] the half of my servants wrought in the work, and the other half of them held both the spears, the shields, and the bows, and the habergeons; and the rulers [were] behind all the house of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised].
They which built on the wall, and they that bore burdens, with those that laded, [every one] with one of his hands wrought in the work, and with the other [hand] held a weapon.
For the builders, everyone had his sword girded by his side, and [so] built. And he that sounded the trumpet [was] by me.
And I said unto the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, The work [is] great and large, and we are separated upon the wall, one far from another.
In what place [therefore] you 2f hear the sound of the trumpet, resort you 2f there unto us: our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] shall fight for us.
So we laboured in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared.
Likewise at the same time said I unto the people, Let everyone with his servant lodge within Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , that in the night they may be a guard to us, and labour on the day.
So neither I, nor my brethren, nor my servants, nor the men of the guard which followed me, none of us put off our clothes, [saving that] every one put them off for washing.
And there was a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brethren the Y’hudim (Judeans).
For there were that said, We, our sons, and our daughters, [are] many: therefore we take up corn [for them] , that we may eat, and live.
[Some] also there were that said, We have mortgaged our lands, vineyards, and houses, that we might buy corn, because of the famine.
There were also that said, We have borrowed money for the king’s tribute, [and that upon] our lands and vineyards.

Yet now our flesh [is] as the flesh of our brethren, our children as their children: and, lo, we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants, and [some] of our daughters are brought unto bondage [already] : neither [is it] in our power [to redeem them] ; for other men have our lands and vineyards.
And I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.

Then I consulted with myself, and I rebuked the nobles, and the rulers, and said unto them, You 2f exact usury (interest paid for using money) , every one of his brother. And I set a great assembly against them.

And I said unto them, We after our ability have redeemed our brethren the Y’hudim (Judeans) , which were sold unto the heathen; and will you 2f even sell your brethren? or shall they be sold unto us? Then held they their peace, and found nothing [to answer].

Also I said, It [is] not good that you 2f do: ought you 2f not to walk in the fear of our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] because of the reproach (disgrace; shame) of the heathen our enemies?
I likewise, [and] my brethren, and my servants, might exact of them money and corn: I pray you, let us leave off this usury (interest paid for using money).

Restore, I pray you, to them, even this day, their lands, their vineyards, their oliveyards, and their houses, also the hundredth [part] of the money, and of the corn, the wine, and the oil, that you 2f exact of them.

Then said they, We will restore [them] , and will require nothing of them; so will we do as you i say. Then I called the priests, and took an oath of them, that they should do according to this promise.

Also I shook my lap, and said, So God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] shake out every man from his house, and from his labour, that performs not this promise, even thus be he shaken out, and emptied. And all the congregation said, Amen, and praised the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) . And the people did according to this promise.

Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , from the twentieth year even unto the two and thirtieth year of Artach’shashta [I will make the spoiled to boil: I will stir myself (in) winter] the king, [that is] , twelve years, I and my brethren have not eaten the bread of the governor.

But the former governors that [had been] before me were chargeable unto the people, and had taken of them bread and wine, beside forty shekels of silver; yes, even their servants bore rule over the people: but so did not I, because of the fear of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered].
Yes, also I continued in the work of this wall, neither bought we any land: and all my servants [were] gathered there unto the work.
Moreover [there were] at my table an hundred and fifty of the Y’hudim (Judeans) and rulers, beside those that came unto us from among the heathen that [are] about us.

Now [that] which was prepared [for me] daily [was] one ox [and] six choice sheep; also fowls were prepared for me, and once in ten days store of all sorts of wine: yet for all this required not I the bread of the governor, because the bondage was heavy upon this people.
Think upon me, my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , for good, [according] to all that I have done for this people.

Now it came to pass, when Sanvalat [strength] , and Toviyah [Yehovah is good] , and Geshem [rain] the Aravi [Arabian] , and the rest of our enemies, heard that I had built the wall, and [that] there was no breach (breaking forth; a break; opening, inlet) left in it; (though at that time I had not set up the doors upon the gates;)
That Sanvalat [strength] and Geshem [rain] sent unto me, saying, Come, let us meet together in [some one of] the villages in the plain of Ono [vigorous] . But they thought to do me mischief.
And I sent messengers unto them, saying, I [am] doing a great work, so that I cannot come down: why should the work cease, whilst I leave it, and come down to you?
Yet they sent unto me four times after this sort; and I answered them after the same manner.
Then sent Sanvalat [strength] his servant unto me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand;

Wherein [was] written, It is reported among the heathen, and Geshemu [rain] says [it, that] you i and the Y’hudim (Judeans) think to rebel: for which cause you i build the wall, that you i may be their king, according to these words.

And you i have also appointed prophets to preach of you i at Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , saying, [There is] a king in Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] : and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together.
Then I sent unto him, saying, There are no such things done as you i say, but you i pretend them out of you i own heart.
For they all made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it be not done. Now therefore, [O God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered]] , strengthen my hands.

Afterward I came unto the house of Sh’may’yah [Yehovah hears] the son of D’layahu [Yehovah has accomplished] the son of M’heitav’el [Favoured of God] , who [was] shut up; and he said, Let us meet together in the house of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , within the temple, and let us shut the doors of the temple: for they will come to slay you i ; yes, in the night will they come to slay you i.
And I said, Should such a man as I flee? and who [is there] , that, [being] as I [am] , would go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in.

And, lo, I perceived that God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] had not sent him; but that he pronounced this prophecy against me: for Toviyah [Yehovah is good] and Sanvalat [strength] had hired him.
Therefore [was] he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, and [that] they might have [matter] for an evil report, that they might reproach (disgrace; shame) me.

My God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , think you i upon Toviyah [Yehovah is good] and Sanvalat [strength] according to these their works, and on the prophetess No’adyah [meeting with Yehovah] , and the rest of the prophets, that would have put me in fear.
So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth [day] of [the month] Elul, in fifty and two days.

And it came to pass, that when all our enemies heard [thereof] , and all the heathen that [were] about us saw [these things] , they were much cast down in their own eyes: for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered].
Moreover in those days the nobles of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] sent many letters unto Toviyah [Yehovah is good] , and [the letters] of Toviyah [Yehovah is good] came unto them.

For [there were] many in Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] sworn unto him, because he [was] the son in law of Sh’khanyah [dweller with Yehovah] the son of Arach [traveller] ; and his son Yochanan [Yehovah has graced] had taken the daughter of Meshulam [friend] the son of Berekhyah [Yehovah blesses].
Also they reported his good deeds before me, and uttered my words to him. [And] Toviyah [Yehovah is good] sent letters to put me in fear.
Now it came to pass, when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors, and the porters and the singers and the Levi’im (Levites) [Joined to] were appointed,

That I gave my brother Hanani [gracious] , and Hananyah [God has favoured] the ruler of the palace, charge over Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] : for he [was] a faithful man, and feared God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] above many.

And I said unto them, Let not the gates of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] be opened until the sun be hot; and while they stand by, let them shut the doors, and bar [them] : and appoint watches of the inhabitants of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , everyone in his watch, and every one [to be] over against his house.
Now the city [was] large and great: but the people [were] few in it, and the houses [were] not built.

And my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] put into my heart to gather together the nobles, and the rulers, and the people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. And I found a register of the genealogy of them which came up at the first, and found written in it,

These [are] the children of the province, that went up out of the captivity, of those that had been carried away, whom N’vukhadnetzar [May Nebo protect the crown] the king of Bavel (to jumble, or a confused medley of sounds; confusion; gate of the deity) (Babylon) [confusion] had carried away, and came again to Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] and to Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , every one unto his city;

Who came with Z’rubavel [sown in Babylon] , Yeshua [he is saved] , Nechemyah [God comforts] , ‘Azaryah [Yehovah has helped] , Ra’amyah [thunder of Yehovah] , Nachamani [merciful] , Mordekhai [little man] , Bilshan [in slander] , Misperet [number] , Bigvai [in my bodies] , N’chum [comfort] , Ba’anah [in affliction] . The number, [I say] , of the men of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] [was this];
The children of Par’osh [flea] , two thousand an hundred seventy and two.

And [one] of the sons of Yoyada [Yehovah knows] , the son of Elyashiv [God restores] the High Priest, [was] son in law to Sanvalat [strength] the Horoni [native of twin caves] : therefore I chased him from me.
Remember them, O my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , because they have defiled the priesthood, and the covenant of the priesthood, and of the Levi’im (Levites) [Joined to].
Thus cleansed I them from all strangers, and appointed the wards of the priests and the Levi’im (Levites) [Joined to] , everyone in his business;
And for the wood offering, at times appointed, and for the firstfruits. Remember me, O my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , for good.
